us.ihmc.euclid.geometry

Class ConvexPolygon2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.ConvexPolygon2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConvexPolygon2DBasics, ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly, Vertex2DSupplier, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<ConvexPolygon2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<ConvexPolygon2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<ConvexPolygon2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<ConvexPolygon2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable

    public class ConvexPolygon2D
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConvexPolygon2DBasics, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<ConvexPolygon2D>
    Describes a planar convex polygon defined in the XY-plane.

    The vertices of a convex polygon are clockwise ordered and are all different.

    This implementation of convex polygon is designed for garbage free operations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConvexPolygon2D

        public ConvexPolygon2D()
        Creates an empty convex polygon.

      • ConvexPolygon2D

        public ConvexPolygon2D(Vertex2DSupplier vertex2DSupplier)
        Creates a new convex polygon such that it represents the convex hull of all the points provided by the supplier.

        Note that the resulting polygon is ready to be used for any operations, no need to call update().

        Parameters:
        vertex2DSupplier - the supplier of vertices.
        See Also:
        ConvexPolygon2DBasics.set(Vertex2DSupplier)

      • ConvexPolygon2D

        public ConvexPolygon2D(Vertex3DSupplier vertex3DSupplier)
        Creates a new convex polygon such that it represents the convex hull of all the points provided by the supplier.

        Note that the resulting polygon is ready to be used for any operations, no need to call update().

        Parameters:
        vertex3DSupplier - the supplier of vertices.
        See Also:
        ConvexPolygon2DBasics.set(Vertex2DSupplier)

      • ConvexPolygon2D

        public ConvexPolygon2D(Vertex2DSupplier firstVertex2DSupplier,
                       Vertex2DSupplier secondVertex2DSupplier)
        Creates a new convex polygon by combining the vertices from two suppliers. The result is the smallest convex hull that contains all the vertices provided by the two suppliers.

        Note that the resulting polygon is ready to be used for any operations, no need to call update().

        Parameters:
        firstVertex2DSupplier - the first supplier of vertices.
        secondVertex2DSupplier - the second supplier of vertices.
        See Also:
        ConvexPolygon2DBasics.set(Vertex2DSupplier, Vertex2DSupplier)

    • Method Detail

      • generateRandomConvexPolygon2d

        @Deprecated
public static ConvexPolygon2D generateRandomConvexPolygon2d(java.util.Random random,
                                                                         double maxAbsoluteXY,
                                                                         int numberOfPossiblePoints)
        Deprecated. Use EuclidGeometryRandomTools.nextConvexPolygon2D(Random, double, int) instead.
        Generates a random convex polygon given the maximum absolute coordinate value of its vertices and the size of the point cloud from which it is generated.
        Parameters:
        random - the random generator to use.
        maxAbsoluteXY - the maximum absolute value for each coordinate of the vertices.
        numberOfPossiblePoints - the size of the point cloud to generate that is used for computing the random convex polygon. The size of the resulting convex polygon will be less than numberOfPossiblePoints.
        Returns:
        the random convex polygon.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if maxAbsoluteXY < 0.

      • isClockwiseOrdered

        public boolean isClockwiseOrdered()
        Description copied from interface: ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Tests whether the vertices of this polygon are clockwise or counter-clockwise ordered.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        true if the vertices are clockwise ordered, false otherwise.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        After calling this method, the polygon has no vertex, area, or centroid.

        Note that this polygon is marked as being out-of-date. The method ConvexPolygon2DBasics.update() has to be called afterward before being able to perform operations with this polygon.

        Specified by:
        clear in interface ConvexPolygon2DBasics

      • clearAndUpdate

        public void clearAndUpdate()
        After calling this method, the polygon has no vertex, area, or centroid.

        Use only when an empty polygon is desired.

        Specified by:
        clearAndUpdate in interface ConvexPolygon2DBasics

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the vertices so they represent a clockwise convex polygon.

        Call this method after editing the vertices of this polygon.

        Note that this also updates centroid, area and the bounding box of this polygon.

        Specified by:
        update in interface ConvexPolygon2DBasics

      • getVertexUnsafe

        public us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DBasics getVertexUnsafe(int index)
        Description copied from interface: ConvexPolygon2DBasics
        Gets the reference to the indexth vertex of this polygon.

        WARNING: Through this method, the user can modify the vertices of this polygon without it being notified of such change. When modifying a vertex, the method ConvexPolygon2DBasics.notifyVerticesChanged() should be called followed by ConvexPolygon2DBasics.update(). Always prefer using ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly.getVertex(int) instead.

        Note that this polygon's vertices are clockwise ordered and that the first vertex has the lowest x-coordinate.

        Specified by:
        getVertexUnsafe in interface ConvexPolygon2DBasics
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the vertex in the clockwise ordered list.
        Returns:
        the reference to the vertex.

        the are of this polygon.

      • getCentroid

        public us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly getCentroid()
        Gets the read-only reference to the polygon's centroid.

        The centroid is not necessarily equal to the average of this polygon's vertices.

        When viewing a polygon as a physical object with constant density and thickness, the centroid is equivalent to the polygon's center of mass.

        Specified by:
        getCentroid in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Returns:
        the read-only reference to this polygon's centroid.

      • getVertexBufferView

        public java.util.List<? extends us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly> getVertexBufferView()
        Description copied from interface: ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Gets a read-only view of this polygon internal vertex buffer.

        WARNING: The size of the returned list is usually greater than the size of this polygon. The vertices currently composing this polygon are located at the indices ∈ [0; this.getNumberOfVertices()[.

        The returned list is an unmodifiable list created with Collections.unmodifiableList(List).

        Specified by:
        getVertexBufferView in interface ConvexPolygon2DReadOnly
        Returns:
        a read-only view of this polygon internal vertex buffer.

      • epsilonEquals

        public boolean epsilonEquals(ConvexPolygon2D other,
                             double epsilon)
        Tests on a per-component basis on every vertices if this convex polygon is equal to other with the tolerance epsilon.

        The method returns false if the two polygons have different size.

        Specified by:
        epsilonEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<ConvexPolygon2D>
        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use.
        Returns:
        true if the two line segments are equal, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        OutdatedPolygonException - if update() has not been called since last time this polygon's vertices were edited.
        EmptyPolygonException - if this polygon is empty when calling this method.

      • geometricallyEquals

        public boolean geometricallyEquals(ConvexPolygon2D other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Compares this and other to determine if the two convex polygons are geometrically similar.

        This method performs the comparison on a per vertex basis while accounting for a possible shift in the polygon indexing. For instance, two polygons that have the same vertices in clockwise or counter-clockwise order, are considered geometrically equal even if they do not start with the same vertex.

        Specified by:
        geometricallyEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<ConvexPolygon2D>
        Parameters:
        other - the convex polygon to compare to.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the convex polygons represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
